commit_message:
Update aggregate should not allow duplicated names

It is not allow to create 2 aggregates with the same name
but if update an existing one with a name already used
by other aggregate that check should be made.
This patch doesn't allow to change the name to an existing
one.

Change-Id: Icfe315594beaec94229e5a4a4c1bb80fc366b66e
Closes-Bug: #1288296
(cherry picked from commit 2b2decfd1b5b0d68813bc7e5b5e4349a1ab592aa)

commit_message:
Fix difference between mysql & psql of flavor-show

If you create a new flavor using a deleted flavorid,
the result of flavor-show is different between mysql and psql.

This issue is caused by the different processing for index in each db.

We need to specify the sort-type to avoid the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1029e80c1b981e1ec86d954b63f83650c9b1cc1
Closes-Bug: #1288636
(cherry picked from commit 4bbb4d88595cfd5f75528d8789be94d0ec9fbe62)

commit_message:
libvirt: Custom disk_bus setting is being lost on hard_reboot

Currently, a non-default disk_bus setting of and image will not be used,
when powering on an instance (or _hard_reboot).

hard_reboot() should use image_meta, if it exist, when constructing
the disk_info

Closes-Bug: #1255449

(cherry picked from commit 0fe3001d639df81ae4e5f77bcfc32bc1bffb014e)

Conflicts:
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: I477f69c47515ad22165421b4d23ac865c7869873

commit_message:
Add missing "load url from future" in a container template

The modified template uses new syntax for the URL template tag,
but doesn't load the new syntax definition, as required by Django.
This leads to errors when trying to render that template.

Change-Id: I42ddb39cad62b1be0cad81d4758412a981be461e
Closes-bug: #1331271
(cherry picked from commit 8c711e8f6b80bebe9ad49eb6a718b2aba0e2b11b)

auth systems. this patch adds a fallback when discovery does not
work.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-13 00:39:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Fixes network_get_all_by_host to use indexes

The OR in the subquery was constructed in a way that didn't allow
the fixed_ips without instances allocated to be filtered out. It
also had an unnecessary join through virtual interfaces. We have a
denormalized field for instance_uuid with an index in the fixed_ips
table that we can use. This patch removes the unnecessary join and
ads an extra filter inside the OR to reject fixed_ips without
instances. In my test with 300000 fixed ips, this reduced the query
time from about 2.5 seconds to less than 0.01 seconds.

Change-Id: I26fb0dfaf5ff64bd70c947982de4ec1728c84856
Resolves-bug: #1369009
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes network_get_all_by_host to use indexes

The OR in the subquery was constructed in a way that didn't allow
the fixed_ips without instances allocated to be filtered out. It
also had an unnecessary join through virtual interfaces. We have a
denormalized field for instance_uuid with an index in the fixed_ips
table that we can use. This patch removes the unnecessary join and
ads an extra filter inside the OR to reject fixed_ips without
instances. In my test with 300000 fixed ips, this reduced the query
time from about 2.5 seconds to less than 0.01 seconds.

Change-Id: I26fb0dfaf5ff64bd70c947982de4ec1728c84856
Resolves-bug: #1369009

commit_message:
Make rescheduling of l3 agent more resilient

In order to make l3 agent restart more resilient
and idempotent do:

1) delete agent after resource is stopped and
all the stuff is cleaned up

2) reschedule not only dead routers/networks but also
orphaned routers/networks

3) enclose get_pid_list_for_ns_list function argument
in cleanup function into double quoutes
or it will use only the first argument
and will not work with several networks

Change-Id: I06a89f0015c8f188d212995ed0652c5ee2cc1c47
Related-Bug: #1371550

commit_message:
Fix unstable assertion in test_cinder_endpoints

In simple_read_only.test_cinder.test_cinder_endpoints, the test case
assumes that the first table of 'cinder endpoints' always ['nova',
'Value']. However, it is sometimes wrong.
So in this commit, the test verifies that they have 2 or more headers
and has a 'Value' header.

Change-Id: Idb3f2ebc6b7e05178621ac3701b7c3d02e1d7591
Closes-Bug: #1363018
Closes-Bug: #1362703

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-17 14:24:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging

* Cleanup lockutils logging by showing lock name and function in
same line.  The enables easier parsing of information related to lock
acquisition from logs.

* Logs time a thread spent waiting on locks, as well as time spent
holding locks.  This will make it easier to debug suboptimal locking.

Change-Id: Ic310d84eb1ed75cc1c21c3d7861b4a3927ebaf23
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-18 13:25:36.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging

* Cleanup lockutils logging by showing lock name and function in
same line.  The enables easier parsing of information related to lock
acquisition from logs.

* Logs time a thread spent waiting on locks, as well as time spent

Change-Id: Ic310d84eb1ed75cc1c21c3d7861b4a3927ebaf23

commit_message:
Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging

* Cleanup lockutils logging by showing lock name and function in
same line.  The enables easier parsing of information related to lock
acquisition from logs.

* Logs time a thread spent waiting on locks, as well as time spent
holding locks.  This will make it easier to debug suboptimal locking.

Change-Id: Ic310d84eb1ed75cc1c21c3d7861b4a3927ebaf23

the refactoring in Ie1ac42d61e920ac8ea1ebab35c2db096fd313077

commit_message:
Add _ prefix to local variables

A lot of __init__ methods were assigning
values to attributes that were not prefixed with
a single underscore, the underscore prefix has been
added as needed.

Closes-Bug: 1239834

by formating the messages obtained from the storage.

subject: Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-19 15:18:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py'], 'message': "Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

Closes-Bug: #1366083
cherry-picked from commit 9cc9cf111ef8a0265df5323fecaed12b0dabe312
Change-Id: I740d8f1b87db911242326a38ff398b81c5974cea
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

Closes-Bug: #1366083
cherry-picked from commit 9cc9cf111ef8a0265df5323fecaed12b0dabe312
Change-Id: I740d8f1b87db911242326a38ff398b81c5974cea

commit_message:
Early framework for the EC Reconstructor

Patch that adds the reconstructor daemon and a placeholder for
tests.  There are several TODOs related to Trello items that
can be worked on independently by various developers, thus
looking to land this patch on the integration branch to enable
that work.

Sleep on the verb RUGGEDIZE, it may grow on you :) We can always
change it later.... and likely will

Change-Id: Ic203cb313193fc4b0e557b299ea11d5d45e80d24
Implements: blueprint ec-reconstructor

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 22:39:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set default API_WORKERS

Setting the default for API_WORKERS to reduce some meory usage is a useful change
and can be pinned to the number of CPUs available.

* Updates https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117517/ to set a default worker
  count at nproc/2 for all services configured to use API_WORKERS.  Removes
  the conditional as API_WORKERS should always be set.
* Update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109058/ for ceilometer to use API_WORKERS

The following reviews can move forward either as-is or with minor tweaks:
* Keystone: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121384/ - remove the if check
* Swift: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121456/ - unabandon, the default
  to 1 is fine, or remove it to match the others.
* Trove: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121438/ - remove the if check

Additional services can be updated as desired.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-workers has the details

Change-Id: Id28d72ebf01c88b7df301edf7d1dd7ec23fcd0d6

commit_message:
Set default API_WORKERS

Set the API_WORKERS default to control memory usage. Maximum is nproc / 2 and
minimum is 2.

* Also updates https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117517/ to remove the
  conditional test as API_WORKERS should always be set.
* Update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109058/ for ceilometer to use API_WORKERS

The following reviews can move forward either as-is or with minor tweaks:
* Keystone: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121384/ - remove the if check
* Swift: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121456/ - unabandon, the default
  to 1 is fine, or remove it to match the others.
* Trove: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121438/ - remove the if check

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-workers has the details

Change-Id: Id28d72ebf01c88b7df301edf7d1dd7ec23fcd0d6

commit_message:
Remove ramdisk build option for Ironic agent driver

This was overlooked when Ironic gained the ability to set
IRONIC_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Id8f8dced716baca7e6ab8a209cddd59bb6783673

commit_message:
Catch Exception instead of RuntimeError for driver

The latest version of stevedore re-raises the real exception instead of
raising RuntimeError. This patch replaces `RuntimeError` with
`Exception` and catches connection failures correctly.

In addition, this conenction failures are now logged.

Change-Id: I39c64221180f25be0d31134f3a16a894ca2dd51f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-31 10:13:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure user metadata mapped for instance notifications

Fixes bug 1284073

For pollster-originated samples related to instances, we apply a
mapping to the user metadata so as to ensure that there are no
embedded periods in metadata keys and also to exclude any metadata
not matching the configured reserved namespace.

Now this logic is also applied to user metadata for samples derived
from instance-related notifications in order to avoid failures when
persisting these data in mongodb.

(cherry picked from commiti ddeb54bb0d2c4203332a5ecc09a4aedfce353a4c)

commit_message:
Ensure user metadata mapped for instance notifications

Fixes bug 1284073

For pollster-originated samples related to instances, we apply a
mapping to the user metadata so as to ensure that there are no
embedded periods in metadata keys and also to exclude any metadata
not matching the configured reserved namespace.

Now this logic is also applied to user metadata for samples derived
from instance-related notifications in order to avoid failures when
persisting these data in mongodb.

(cherry picked from commit ddeb54bb0d2c4203332a5ecc09a4aedfce353a4c)
Change-Id: I77eab59023fa23c5879b05c948bd4cb1db7fa177

Compute node.
1. valid units are: MB or GB, MB being default choice
2. allow space separator(s) between number and unit
3. no space between number and unit is also allowed
4. use default value if no property mem_size is not given

commit_message:
Represent memory unit in string

Enable unit representation for property 'mem_size' in
Compute node.
1. valid units are: MB or GB, MB being default choice
2. allow space separator(s) between number and unit
3. no space between number and unit is also allowed
4. use default value if no property mem_size is not given
5. use default value if mem_size value is not specified
6. default value is 1024 MB

Blue Print: Represent memory unit in string

Change-Id: I0850a6dcb627f1a4bb4f24242b530fa42f598ce3

commit_message:
Represent memory unit in string

Enable unit representation for property 'mem_size' in
Compute node.
1. valid units are: MB or GB, MB being default choice
2. allow space separator(s) between number and unit
3. no space between number and unit is also allowed
4. use default value if no property mem_size is not given
5. default value is 1024 MB

Blue Print: Represent memory unit in string

Change-Id: Id1f59eb4bac0d8c31cdbdb9845525de9ddb948d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-15 01:16:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Problems with DVR-Router updates after ext-gw set

A few problems with SNAT handling in the l3-agent
and scheduler have been found.

- A fix has been found for when a router is updated
after a gateway-set has been done where SNAT namespaces
are created on all nodes (CNs and NNs).
Closes-bug: #1356734

- Even with no VMs present, qrouter namespaces are being
created when a router is updated after a gateway-set
has been done. TBD.

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-15 23:48:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Problems with DVR-Router updates after ext-gw set

A few problems with SNAT handling in the l3-agent
and scheduler have been found.

- A fix has been found for when a router is updated
after a gateway-set has been done where SNAT namespaces
are created on all nodes (CNs and NNs).

Fixes the issue of qrouter getting created on
all nodes when router-update happens.

Fixes the issue where SNAT namespace and qrouter
namespace not created when a router-create command
is executed with the gateway - singel REST call.

In all the above cases now the namespaces will be
created only when there is a valid VM in the subnet.

Closes-bug: #1356734
Closes-bug: #1353266
Closes-bug: #1356639

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b

and scheduler have been found.

- A fix has been found for when a router is updated
after a gateway-set has been done where SNAT namespaces
are created on all nodes (CNs and NNs).

Fixes the issue of qrouter getting created on
all nodes when router-update happens.

Fixes the issue where SNAT namespace and qrouter
namespace not created when a router-create command
is executed with the gateway - singel REST call.

In all the above cases now the namespaces will be
created only when there is a valid VM in the subnet.

Closes-bug: #1356734
Closes-bug: #1353266
Closes-bug: #1356639

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

A few problems with SNAT handling in the l3-agent

A fix has been found for when a router is updated

are created on all nodes (CNs and NNs).

Fixes the issue of qrouter getting created on

Fixes the issue where SNAT namespace and qrouter

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-08-22 21:47:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Problems with DVR-Router updates after ext-gw set

When SNAT namespaces and Router namespaces are
created, the scheduler identifies the agent type,
the plugin checks for dvr related port
availability and agent creates the respective
namespaces.

The router update actions such as

  1. Interface Add/Delete
  2. Extra_Routes Add/Delete
  3. External Gateway Set/Clear

was triggering the initial router scheduling
and namespace creation.

But when a router is created along with Gateway,
this action does not trigger a router update.
So the scheduler was not aware about the gateway
being added to the router and so it was not
creating the right namespaces. This issue is
fixed with this patch.

Also the plugin check for dvr related port was
returing "true" even when there were no valid
subnets associated with a router.
This patch fixes this issue and so now the
qrouter namespaces will only be created in DVR
nodes that host the VMs.

"qrouters" created for SNAT support on DVR_SNAT
node even if there is no VMs is an Exception,
that is a known behavior.

The agent was creating SNAT namespaces on all
nodes including DVR and DVR_SNAT nodes even
though the binding was done for the DVR_SNAT
node. This patch also fixes this issue.

Closes-bug: #1356734
Closes-bug: #1353266
Closes-bug: #1356639

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b
', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2014-08-25 19:38:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor the DVR scheduler to get rid of hints

When SNAT namespaces and Router namespaces are
created, the scheduler identifies the agent type,
the plugin checks for dvr related port
availability and agent creates the respective
namespaces.

The router update actions such as

  1. Interface Add/Delete
  2. Extra_Routes Add/Delete
  3. External Gateway Set/Clear

was triggering the initial router scheduling
and namespace creation based on the hints that
was passed in.

But when a router is created along with Gateway,
this action does not trigger a router update,
since there was no hints being passed during the
create operation.

Hence the scheduler was not aware about the gateway
being added to the router and so it was not
creating the right namespaces.

By refactoring the DVR scheduler code to not
depend on the hints fixed this issue and it made
the flow more predictable.

Closes-bug: #1353266
Closes-bug: #1356639

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b

commit_message:
Avoid an extra database query in schedule_snat_router

bind_snat_servicenode already knows the chosen_agent.  By waiting
until after it is called, we can use it to avoid another db query.

Closes-bug: #1353266
Closes-bug: #1356639
Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

Change-Id: Iba5668b2717e188d5289ede982bfc1b46f4eeb5b

[{'created': '2014-09-18 22:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/integrated/test_multiprocess_api.py'], 'message': "Close standard fds in test child process

The std fd's are shared with parent processes, which makes testr think
that we still have test workers, even though this isn't a test

Partial-Bug: #1357578

commit_message:
Close standard fds in test child process

The std fd's are shared with parent processes, which makes testr think
that we still have test workers, even though this isn't a test
process, its a live server.

Change-Id: I516a6a9bd9a98abffeb182189038763ea94618f6
Partial-Bug: #1357578

commit_message:
Revert iSCSI Target objects as independent objects

Removing from gate queue since failing unit tests

The second half of this code didn't make it in, so this is essentially
dead code. We'll readd this code back in Kilo.

This reverts commit d10fb796f491152486e394481e920479bab9e3d1.

Closes-Bug: #1365516
Change-Id: Ia4b3b4ef4a7b6f3829fe576ec370b6d74a7bc922

subject: Message was send to wrong node with use zmq as rpc_backend
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 935, 'name': 'James Page', 'email': 'james.page@canonical.com', 'username': 'james-page'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3211, 'name': 'zhangjialong', 'email': 'zhangjl@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhangjl'}, {'_account_id': 4912, 'name': 'Michael H Wilson', 'email': 'geekinutah@gmail.com', 'username': 'geekinutah'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7805, 'name': 'Li Ma', 'email': 'skywalker.nick@gmail.com', 'username': 'Nick'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-03 04:49:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Message was sended to wrong node with use zmq as rpc_backend

When use zmq as rpc_backend of nova, message cannot
send to correct node because the queues we got
from matchmaker maybe is wrong. To fix this problem,
as server item in oslo.messaging.target.Target object,
and the server item is the correct node which message
should be send to, we use Target object to create
queues. Then, message can be send to the 'real' node
which shoule received it.

commit_message:
Message was send to wrong node with use zmq as rpc_backend

zmq: Send message to correct endpoint for directed messages

If set the zmq driver needs to use the topic.server
attribute to ensure that messages directed to a
specific endpoint are sent to the correct server rather
than being randomly sent to endpoints advertising the
required topic.

Change-Id: If63235640e0b8e6ec8690a4edaefa1b303705ac6
Closes-bug: #1301723

not resetting the nova firewall driver.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Whenever Q_USE_SECGROUP was set to True in local.conf, lib/neutron script was
not resetting the nova firewall driver.

The neutron script was fixed to change the nova firewall_driver to NoopFirewallDriver
whenever Q_USE_SECGROUP was set to True

This closes bug: 1248381
"nova firewall set to IpTablesFirewallDriver when neutron sec groups enabled"

Change-Id: Iaf42a5b0e7492d231327d980afb5d1ea8928369b

subject: There was a mismatch in case when referring to security groups between ml2 and ovs.
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-15 22:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ml2'], 'message': 'There was a mismatch in case when referring to security groups between ml2 and
ovs.

ML2 was referring to the security group directive as SECURITYGROUP whereas
OVS is referring it as securitygroup

Fix was to change the ML2 to refer to securitygroup

This closes bug : 1248385

Change-Id: I4351ee1aba5f524427523c7419d4430db3f476ac
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
There was a mismatch in case when referring to security groups between ml2 and
ovs.

ML2 was referring to the security group directive as SECURITYGROUP whereas
OVS is referring it as securitygroup

Fix was to change the ML2 to refer to securitygroup

This closes bug : 1248385

Change-Id: I4351ee1aba5f524427523c7419d4430db3f476ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-15 03:31:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set ipset_enabled to False by default

The default is currently set to True which is not upgrade friendly in
that anyone upgrading to the most recent Neutron code immediately has to
have the ipset binary installed or their commands fail.

It seems like we should set this to false by default (as a safe default)
and allow users to opt in since it is really an optimization.

This patch recently broke TripleO CI for this very reason.

Change-Id: Icea7869901483392c55dea27cc711619aba62376
Closes-bug: #1369386
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-15 03:46:10.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Set enable_ipset to False by default

The default is currently set to True which is not upgrade friendly in
that anyone upgrading to the most recent Neutron code immediately has to
have the ipset binary installed or their commands fail.

It seems like we should set this to false by default (as a safe default)
and allow users to opt in since it is really an optimization.

This patch recently broke TripleO CI for this very reason.

Change-Id: Icea7869901483392c55dea27cc711619aba62376
Closes-bug: #1369386
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Set enable_ipset to False by default

The default is currently set to True which is not upgrade friendly in
that anyone upgrading to the most recent Neutron code immediately has to
have the ipset binary installed or their commands fail.

It seems like we should set this to false by default (as a safe default)
and allow users to opt in since it is really an optimization.

This patch recently broke TripleO CI for this very reason.

Change-Id: Icea7869901483392c55dea27cc711619aba62376
Closes-bug: #1369386

commit_message:
Construct ZmqListener with correct arguments

The ZmqListener constructor only accepts a driver as an argument.

Drop surplus 'None' in listen_for_notifications method.

Change-Id: I6aec91122bb9406e387728eb2a2380f2c2094595
Closes-Bug: #1368154

commit_message:
Reduce redundant parameter of some commands in CLI

When deleting an alarm, we use "ceilometer alarm-delete -a <ALARM_ID>",
unlike other deleting commands of openstack, the parameter-a/--alarm_id
is redundant. The similar situations exist in showing alarm, geting alarm
state, showing resource and so on.
It is more easy to use for reducing these parameters.

New behaviour:

$ ceilometer help alarm-show
usage: ceilometer alarm-show [<ALARM_ID>]

Show an alarm.

Positional arguments:
  <ALARM_ID>  ID of the alarm to show.

$ ceilometer alarm-show
alarm_id should not be empty

$ ceilometer alarm-show abcde
Not Found (HTTP 404)

$ ceilometer alarm-show -a abcde
-a is obsolete! See help for more details.
Not Found (HTTP 404)

$ ceilometer alarm-show --alarm_id abcde
--alarm_id is obsolete! See help for more details.
Not Found (HTTP 404)

Co-Authored-By: Nejc Saje <nsaje@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1fbc85aa253929bfbb5e73ed834a725b9cf828b4
Closes-bug: #1268557

commit_message:
clean up swift middleware to avoid unicode errors

the swift middleware does not handle environment variables correctly.
this is causing ceilometer errors to be thrown in syslogs in the
check-swift-dsvm-full tests.

this patch adds in unicode support.

Closes-Bug: #1369124
Change-Id: Icf0874efcc69d9889df591b2cb4bbdd3930eaf68

commit_message:
Adding common.utils.exception_to_str() to avoid encoding issue

1. Ported common.utils.exception_to_str() back to glance_store.
2. Used exception_to_str() to consistently cast the exception to avoid
potential encoding issue.

Change-Id: I398ea0e218ebb37b9041cfe82f18b11e614662bf
Related-Id: I77478a8eeeefd85bf98138156429df53d0a4c079
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

tests. It actually manipulates session, which none of the rest of them
do. The test boils down to testing for a specific sqla exception,
though there is no code in the rest of nova that does anything with
that kind of exception. Also it's definitively racey and has caused a

commit_message:
delete test_security_group_get_no_instances

This test is very much not in line with the rest of the db_api
tests. It actually manipulates session, which none of the rest of them
do. The test boils down to testing for a specific sqla exception,
though there is no code in the rest of nova that does anything with
that kind of exception. Also it's definitively racey and has caused a
number of gate resets because something that it is doing with the db
is not safe.

We should just remove it.

Change-Id: I64002dea3c68c18f4e2a2f32ed27d48dcc62d26a
Closes-Bug: #1349147

commit_message:
Update to newer Centos7 images

Update to newer Centos7 images as announced at [1].

Changes included:
 * update to GA image
 * respect TMP_DIR for image working directory
 * use suffix-match rather than prefix-match to build RAW_IMAGE name
   to be more robust against weird names
 * partition layout work-arounds not needed any-more, all one
   partition.

Resulting image booted locally with kvm and virtualbox (after
conversion to vdi)

[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2014-August/msg00045.html

Closes-Bug: #1363146
Change-Id: Ie24033468b78587ea87188ee1b843b26895798ff

commit_message:
Pin docutils to 0.9.1

Docutils 0.10 breaks manpage generation in sphinx 1.1.3. A fix to
sphinx has been merged, but not yet released (scheduled for dec
24-31). In the mean time, we should pin docutils to 0.9.1.

Similar change was present before as
I157f3c191bfc09d2191a3508d81bcbaea56205a6 but was incorrectly removed by
later requirements syncs.

Closes-Bug: 1091333
Change-Id: I157f3c191bfc09d2191a3508d81bcbaea56205a6

commit_message:
Move over a reflection module that taskflow uses

Taskflow has a quite useful reflection module that it would
appear others would benefit from having access to, so instead
of keeping it in taskflow, move it over to oslo.utils so that
others can benefit from it.

Potential users:

- Oslo.db
- Cinder
- Taskflow (where the code used to exist)
- Others doing name lookup or other reflection functionality

Change-Id: I9fbdd86966afddb862cb7faed2f88298a9f956cf

[{'created': '2014-09-16 14:24:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: avoid need for lockutils setup running test cases

Some of the firewall/driver test cases rely on lockutils being
setup, so running tests directly fails:

 $ .venv/bin/python -m testtools.run nova.tests.virt.libvirt
 ...snip...
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py", line 10182, in test_multinic_iptables
        self.fw.prepare_instance_filter(instance_ref, network_info)
      File "nova/virt/firewall.py", line 184, in prepare_instance_filter
        self.refresh_provider_fw_rules()
      File "nova/virt/firewall.py", line 474, in refresh_provider_fw_rules
        self._do_refresh_provider_fw_rules()
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 267, in inner
        with lock(name, lock_file_prefix, external, lock_path):
      File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 17, in __enter__
        return self.gen.next()
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 231, in lock
        ext_lock = external_lock(name, lock_file_prefix, lock_path)
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 180, in external_lock
        lock_file_path = _get_lock_path(name, lock_file_prefix, lock_path)
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 171, in _get_lock_path
        raise cfg.RequiredOptError('lock_path')
    RequiredOptError: value required for option: lock_path

The first workaround is to launch using (which run_tests.sh does)

 $ python -m nova.openstack.common.lockutils

but it is nicer to developers if we just avoid the need for using
external lock files during the test suite execution entirely. This
can be done by mocking the 'external_lock' method to use a transient
semaphore instead of external lock file on disk.

Closes-bug: #1369973
Change-Id: I3dcdf6353986ff35c7237644f467ee7e98423f76

commit_message:
libvirt: avoid need for lockutils setup running test cases

Some of the firewall/driver test cases rely on lockutils being
setup, so running tests directly fails:

 $ .venv/bin/python -m testtools.run nova.tests.virt.libvirt
 ...snip...
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py", line 10182, in test_multinic_iptables
        self.fw.prepare_instance_filter(instance_ref, network_info)
      File "nova/virt/firewall.py", line 184, in prepare_instance_filter
        self.refresh_provider_fw_rules()
      File "nova/virt/firewall.py", line 474, in refresh_provider_fw_rules
        self._do_refresh_provider_fw_rules()
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 267, in inner
        with lock(name, lock_file_prefix, external, lock_path):
      File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 17, in __enter__
        return self.gen.next()
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 231, in lock
        ext_lock = external_lock(name, lock_file_prefix, lock_path)
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 180, in external_lock
        lock_file_path = _get_lock_path(name, lock_file_prefix, lock_path)
      File "nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 171, in _get_lock_path
        raise cfg.RequiredOptError('lock_path')
    RequiredOptError: value required for option: lock_path

The first workaround is to launch using (which run_tests.sh does)

 $ python -m nova.openstack.common.lockutils

but it is nicer to developers if we just avoid the need for using
external lock files during the test suite execution entirely. This
can be done by mocking the 'external_lock' method to use a transient
semaphore instead of external lock file on disk.

Closes-bug: #1369973
Change-Id: I3dcdf6353986ff35c7237644f467ee7e98423f76

commit_message:
Remove neutron cherry pick to disable ipset

Removes cherry pick for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121434/
which got a -2 (so I abandoned it).

TripleO works now with ipset because we landed
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121435/ instead which
simply installs the ipset package.

Change-Id: I03301091b041c60dfbe5ac93810fbfeb35d0e671

commit_message:
Add a cherrypick utility function

Adds a function to cherry pick a specific Gerrit refspec.

As we are having to cherry pick quite a few commits
to keep TripleO CI running while things creep through
the gate this should be helpful.

commit_message:
NSX: log request body to NSX as debug

Previously we never logged the request body that we sent to NSX. This makes
things hard to debug when issues arise as we don't actually log the body of
the request that we made. This patch adds the body to our issue request log
statement.

Change-Id: I7d98e3d844ebe565fb5919aac3f9afd5b4040e69
Closes-bug: 1360394
(cherry picked from commit 2bc898ff7a18928e94eb81b24dc99d5cb20eae8a)

', 'number': 41}, {'created': '2014-09-08 16:43:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add HA support to the l3 agent

* Add HA mixins used by RouterInfo and LNAT3Agent
* For HA routers: Internal, external and floating IP addresses are no
  longer configured by the agent. Instead the interfaces and addresses
  are passed to a keepalived configuration, which configures the
  addresses when the router transitions to the master state.
* Only the master instance of the router opens the metadata proxy.
  This happens due to keepalived notification scripts that are
  called upon state transitions.
* Extra routes are handled via keepalived virtual routes and are
  no longer configured by the agent.
* HA routers create a 'HA device' on a VRRP-traffic only HA-network.
* Functional testing: Add two new tests to the L3 agent:
    1) Translation of a router configuration to a keepalived
       configuration.
    2) HA specific events when creating a HA router - Assert that
       keepalived is up, etc.

Change-Id: I83f2a5d2af42164c42773b385ba7b00872eed54e
Implements: blueprint l3-high-availability
Co-Authored-By: Assaf Muller <amuller@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add HA support to the l3 agent

* Add HA mixins used by RouterInfo and LNAT3Agent
* For HA routers: Internal, external and floating IP addresses are no
  longer configured by the agent. Instead the interfaces and addresses
  are passed to a keepalived configuration, which configures the
  addresses when the router transitions to the master state.
* Only the master instance of the router opens the metadata proxy.
  This happens due to keepalived notification scripts that are
  called upon state transitions.
* Extra routes are handled via keepalived virtual routes and are
  no longer configured by the agent.
* HA routers create a 'HA device' on a VRRP-traffic only HA-network.
* Functional testing: Add two new tests to the L3 agent:
    1) Translation of a router configuration to a keepalived
       configuration.
    2) HA specific events when creating a HA router - Assert that
       keepalived is up, etc.

Change-Id: I83f2a5d2af42164c42773b385ba7b00872eed54e
Implements: blueprint l3-high-availability
Co-Authored-By: Assaf Muller <amuller@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-27 18:47:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': "(WIP) VMware: Support spawn VM with multiple disks

Currently, the VMware driver spawn contains logic to check whether
a block device mapping is provided or not. This branching will either
trigger the logic to boot from an image or to use the volume provided
as the root disk.
However, this implementation doesn't handle the case where the user
wants to boot from an image and attach volumes at the same time.
This patch addresses this issue by checking whether the instance
contains an image reference.
If an image reference is provided: we boot from image, and potentially we
can add block device mappings to the VM created. Otherwise, we use
the volume provided as the root disk.

Change-Id: I16b7d6803aa8a8cc92852499f0353ca88b86a5f3
Closes-Bug: #1271966
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
(WIP) VMware: Support spawn VM with multiple disks

Currently, the VMware driver spawn contains logic to check whether
a block device mapping is provided or not. This branching will either
trigger the logic to boot from an image or to use the volume provided
as the root disk.
However, this implementation doesn't handle the case where the user
wants to boot from an image and attach volumes at the same time.
This patch addresses this issue by checking whether the instance
contains an image reference.
If an image reference is provided: we boot from image, and potentially we
can add block device mappings to the VM created. Otherwise, we use
the volume provided as the root disk.

Change-Id: I16b7d6803aa8a8cc92852499f0353ca88b86a5f3
Closes-Bug: #1271966

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 17:23:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "XenAPI improve post snapshot coalesce detection

The coalesce detection is not working well after this change:
ae2a27ce19f3e24d4a8c713a73e617f4cd71d4b4

The snapshot operation will introduce a new VHD file into the VDI chain,
and in many cases, that would be coalesced during the next SR scan. So
we need to walk the chain after the snapshot has been taken, not before.

This fixes the cause of the mentioned bug, but it doesn't help with
launching the partially corrupted snapshots created because of this bug,
so this only partially fixes the bug.

Change-Id: I0bf7535ae3f7d9e6820f8dc07075892953d80a78
Partial-Bug: #1362595

commit_message:
XenAPI improve post snapshot coalesce detection

The coalesce detection is not working well after this change:
ae2a27ce19f3e24d4a8c713a73e617f4cd71d4b4

The snapshot operation will introduce a new VHD file into the VDI chain,
and in many cases, that would be coalesced during the next SR scan. So
we need to walk the chain after the snapshot has been taken, not before.

This fixes the cause of the mentioned bug, but it doesn't help with
launching the partially corrupted snapshots created because of this bug,
so this only partially fixes the bug.

Change-Id: I0bf7535ae3f7d9e6820f8dc07075892953d80a78
Partial-Bug: #1362595

[{'created': '2014-09-18 13:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Upgrade PyScss to version 1.2.1 and pin it <1.3 for Horizon

PyScss fixed an important bug in parsing Bootstrap 3.2.0
(https://github.com/Kronuz/pyScss/issues/287). While investigating
this book with the upstream developers, we also became aware that
version 1.3 will break backwards compatibility with Django-PyScss
that we are using, so I'm pinning the version.

Change-Id: Ic4c23dcbf35dd55916401bba2b1bc3bf4baa4522
Partial-bug: #1370137
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Upgrade PyScss to version 1.2.1 and pin it <1.3 for Horizon

PyScss fixed an important bug in parsing Bootstrap 3.2.0
(https://github.com/Kronuz/pyScss/issues/287). While investigating
this book with the upstream developers, we also became aware that
version 1.3 will break backwards compatibility with Django-PyScss
that we are using, so I'm pinning the version.

Change-Id: Ic4c23dcbf35dd55916401bba2b1bc3bf4baa4522
Partial-bug: #1370137

commit_message:
Upgrade/update instructions for 5.1; relnotes descriptions

This commit covers all the docs about upgrade and update
as well as refinements to the what-is, new-features, and
other-enhancements sections.

Includes change to use lrzuntar to unpack the 5.1 tarball
with a warning that the Fuel Master node requires 2GB RAM for
this to work, with a link to the hardware requirements for
the master

Includes corrections to the Release Notes Upgrade and Update sections
and to this information in the User Guide.

user-guide/cli.rst -- info from https://review.openstack.org/120428
about the update option.

Ref-Arch now includes 8000-fuel-upgrade that describes how
upgrade works

Release Notes are restructured to include:
- "Known Issues fixed in 5.1 and 5.0.2" is added in 117672
- "HA issues fixed in 5.1" is added in 117338

Change-Id: Ie2054b31ce216942fd64b5bf274d8efa7d300bc4
Closes-Bug: 1360372
Closes-Bug: 1367199

Fix template.rst to be valid.

for this.

Change-Id: I3538bab2104edc63717b865bcb60de881217663f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix build problems

Fix template.rst to be valid.
Use symbolic link for specs directory as it's done with other spec
repositories, the directory will not be found otherwise. Adjust index
for this.

Change-Id: I3538bab2104edc63717b865bcb60de881217663f

commit_message:
Logging features for Fuel and OpenStack

user-guide/config -- debug logging, configure syslog

op-guide/troubleshooting -- using logs

terminology/logging -- brief overview of logging facilities with
links to our docs and community docs for additional information

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-19 10:49:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix two functional tests within tempest_plugin

Couple of functional tests within tempest plugin are generic driver specific,
it verifies API actions of security-services, but for reproducing test cases
tries create shares and share creation fails if enabled backend driver raises
exception in case security-service has fake/improper data.

it verifies API actions of security-services, but for reproducing test cases

commit_message:
Fix two functional tests within tempest_plugin

Couple of functional tests within tempest plugin are generic driver specific,
it verifies API actions of security-services, but for reproducing test cases
tries create shares and share creation fails if enabled backend driver raises
exception in case security-service has fake/improper data.

Change-Id: Ib8915f1f7d52a6abc2f34cac4bba18a6ad7eaf46
Closes-Bug: #1371552

commit_message:
Replace string format arguments with function parameters

There are files containing string format arguments inside
logging messages. Using logging function parameters should
be preferred.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-19 06:00:31.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/build_coreos_image.sh', 'imagebuild/coreos/full_trusty_build.sh'], 'message': "Preserve environment variables when doing sudo

Change-Id: Ic3fbc4ee8189cc82ef99359bf61eef33dae40a5a
Closes-Bug: 1371418

commit_message:
Preserve environment variables when doing sudo

This commit adds the '-E' option for all the sudo commands
in build script of agent which causes it to preserve environment
variables.

Change-Id: Ic3fbc4ee8189cc82ef99359bf61eef33dae40a5a
Closes-Bug: 1371418

commit_message:
Fix dataflow work

 * We should send received task output as input context
   of next task, otherwise we can't get access to previous
   task output.

Change-Id: I18aa4c04d306faa15cd8ad72fc8f170de38df84c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-04 06:10:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reuse API client object in a request

Previously API client object like novaclient are created
every time methods in openstack_dashboard/api.
It leads to regeneration of API HTTP connections.
This commit caches API client object for a WSGI request
to reduce the number of HTTP connection to backends.
As WSGI request object is recreated, a cached API client
object will live in a single request to Horizon.

Change-Id: I66620b3b0a2737c7232d91006e65d0fabbd3090b
Closes-Bug: #1352144
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-04 14:20:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reuse API client object in a request

Previously API client object like novaclient are created
every time methods in openstack_dashboard/api.
It leads to regeneration of API HTTP connections.
This commit caches API client object for a WSGI request
to reduce the number of HTTP connection to backends.
As WSGI request object is recreated, a cached API client
object will live in a single request to Horizon.

commit_message:
Reuse API client object in a request

Previously API client object like novaclient are created
every time methods in openstack_dashboard/api.
It leads to regeneration of API HTTP connections.
This commit caches API client object for a WSGI request
to reduce the number of HTTP connection to backends.
As WSGI request object is recreated, a cached API client
object will live in a single request to Horizon.

Change-Id: I66620b3b0a2737c7232d91006e65d0fabbd3090b
Closes-Bug: #1352144

commit_message:
Decrease squids cache max freshness time

Set the maximum time an object can be considered fresh to 1 day, 3 days
was a too aggressive considering a new package can be released, uploaded
to the openstack pypi mirror and set as a minimum requirement for a project in a shorter timeframe.

Closes-Bug: #1371549
Change-Id: If35d58de6a62bfc7ddd94d807c91c22fc8a09dda

commit_message:
Remove running of one Heat test in system test 'Heat HA'

Heat OSTF 'test_autoscaling' is skipped in the HA mode, but in system tests
skipped test equal failed test, it is not correct in current situation. So need to don't
run test 'test_autoscaling' in the HA Heat system test.

Closes-Bug: #1371025

Change-Id: I5ab0495f4b57249ddce5de99512362f40d22aa2f

commit_message:
Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

Closes-Bug: #1366083
cherry-picked from commit 9cc9cf111ef8a0265df5323fecaed12b0dabe312

Change-Id: I740d8f1b87db911242326a38ff398b81c5974cea

Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

commit_message:
Add should_fail=1 to OSTF run after rollback

We use snapshot of cluster that doesn't have
cinder/ceph nodes, so 'Create volume and attach
it to instance' always fails.

Closes-bug: #1371600

The current implementation works fine for LVM, however the rootwrap

commit_message:
Fix rootwrap for non openstack.org iqn's

The encryption methods implemented for attached volumes
require a symbolic link created to the /dev/disk-by* iqn.

The current implementation works fine for LVM, however the rootwrap
is restricted to only allow iqns of the form openstack.org, for
vendors that use their own target and iqn this won't work and will
result in the attach failing for unauthorized command.

This just makes the regex for the rootwrap filter a bit more
permissive, only looking for iscsi-iqn.*

Closes-Bug: 1362854
(cherry picked from commit 00808f2072c3ee8958ad16eabad7994730bb8b86)

Change-Id: I023ad24867c045a88f72c5ac7ac4e4da097a3643
Conflicts:
	etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters

subject: Avoid referencing stale instance/network_info dicts in firewall
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 12:16:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid referencing stale instance/network_info dicts in firewall

This makes the virt.firewall code cleaner in terms of referencing
the cached instance and network_info code it stores. Before this
patch, concurrent instance operations could modify these two dicts
so that while we're iterating instances, the network_info dict
is suddenly missing information we need.

The right fix for this is to use instance objects and their
associated info_cache objects, but that's a larger fix and one
not as well-suited to backporting to previous releases which
suffer from this as well.

The approach taken here is that we store the instance and
network_info cache together in the same dict that we can pop()
from atomically (this is not really necessary, but helps to
prevent introducing more of these cases). When we iterate over
the contents, we iterate over a copy of the keys, being careful
not to let a suddenly-missing key break us, and passing the
details all the way down the stack instead of having deeper calls
hit the cache dicts again.

Conflicts:
	nova/virt/firewall.py

Change-Id: Ib1cfd68fca7789ca4a3602c25e6b8a956303fff9
Closes-bug: #1182131
(cherry picked from commit 72dd81343e73baf838bc58d413413f0d57018f15)
(cherry picked from commit 9f5d2a6a65edb2a5862c7f07b29ac700cec61f84)

commit_message:
Avoid referencing stale instance/network_info dicts in firewall

This makes the virt.firewall code cleaner in terms of referencing
the cached instance and network_info code it stores. Before this
patch, concurrent instance operations could modify these two dicts
so that while we're iterating instances, the network_info dict
is suddenly missing information we need.

The right fix for this is to use instance objects and their
associated info_cache objects, but that's a larger fix and one
not as well-suited to backporting to previous releases which
suffer from this as well.

The approach taken here is that we store the instance and
network_info cache together in the same dict that we can pop()
from atomically (this is not really necessary, but helps to
prevent introducing more of these cases). When we iterate over
the contents, we iterate over a copy of the keys, being careful
not to let a suddenly-missing key break us, and passing the
details all the way down the stack instead of having deeper calls
hit the cache dicts again.

Conflicts:
	nova/virt/firewall.py

Change-Id: Ib1cfd68fca7789ca4a3602c25e6b8a956303fff9
Closes-bug: #1182131
(cherry picked from commit 72dd81343e73baf838bc58d413413f0d57018f15)
(cherry picked from commit 9f5d2a6a65edb2a5862c7f07b29ac700cec61f84)

commit_message:
Adding sub-status and message to orders

Adding the ability to view sub-status and
messages for orders. Added new Alembic
Version also. Increasing Unit test coverage.

Closes-Bug: #1370485
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-17 15:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py'], 'message': "Allow to set protocol to 'ANY' on firewall rule update

Currently you can only update firewall rule protocol to TCP, UDP or
ICMP but ANY is also a valid protocol.

This change allows to update firewall rule protocol to ANY. In such
case we should send protocol == None to neutron because protocol ANY
means protocol == None in neutron context.

Closes-Bug: #1370485
Change-Id: I2a416f1ce2150fc5fcee06479f9578f688370e7e
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow to set protocol to 'ANY' on firewall rule update

Currently you can only update firewall rule protocol to TCP, UDP or
ICMP but ANY is also a valid protocol.

This change allows to update firewall rule protocol to ANY. In such
case we should send protocol == None to neutron because protocol ANY
means protocol == None in neutron context.

Closes-Bug: #1370485
Change-Id: I2a416f1ce2150fc5fcee06479f9578f688370e7e

commit_message:
Remove references to queue in Zaqar's description

Zaqar is a messaging service which provides support for different
messaging patterns and messaging related semantics. Mentioning `queue`
in the service codename and description misleads people from what the
service goal actually is.

Change-Id: I09df25e0bc9cf1804ea4db67271fb55d1dcce30d

commit_message:
Resourcify the object stuff

Add some resource models to the swift stuff hopefully compatible
with future SDK type resource objects.  I wanted to add to the
object store capabilties, but it would be nice to have a pattern
that was similar to something that will be used in the future.

Change-Id: I611ecf842e452b7ff496fb5eac1d62f4291a61c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-24 03:00:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't refresh network cache for instances building or deleting

Refreshing the network cache for an instance which is still building
is both unnecessary (the build itself will update the cache when it
completes) and can lead to a race condition if the periodic task gets
incomplete network information, then gets pre-empted by the build
thread, and then updates the cache after the build has finished.

Likewise there is no value in updating the network cache for an
instance which is in the process of being deleted.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Don't refresh network cache for instances building or deleting

Refreshing the network cache for an instance which is still building
is both unnecessary (the build itself will update the cache when it
completes) and can lead to a race condition if the periodic task gets
incomplete network information, then gets pre-empted by the build
thread, and then updates the cache after the build has finished.

Likewise there is no value in updating the network cache for an
instance which is in the process of being deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1254320
(cherry picked from commit 713e538237c7fea0b93ade343b1d9368bdbf2698)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py

Change-Id: I7dd1d0a005662b979eaea3476af2506cbc51f17a

commit_message:
Mitigating performance impact with getting pci requests from DB

This change mitigates the performance impact in host manager that
retrieves an instance's PCI requests from DB while consuming it. This
is achieved by adding pci_requests into the instance dict before
calling consume_from_instance() and deleting it afterwards. The
complete solution will be provided when bug 1368260 is fully
addressed. The patch also removes the unnecessary context argument.

Change-Id: Ib0d12cde1c297a04e5d626b28d0a994c5dd4d965
Partial-Bug: 1368260

commit_message:
Added debug env to tox

A test can be run now in debug mode by running:
    tox -edebug <test_name>
e.g.
    tox -edebug test_create_table_duplicate

It is also possible to pass a regex so that you
don't run tests whose name contains the test_name
parameter. If you want just test_create_table to
run you can run just that test with:
    tox -edebug test_create_table$

Change-Id: If02cf5d9f5c44c67ac57689b83e3a2d6c42988fb

commit_message:
Fix KeyError on missing gw_port_host for L3 agent in DVR mode

The order of Mixin imports broke the MRO, which caused some methods
in the L3 hierarchy to be ignored. In particular, _build_routers_list
for DVR was no longer called, which led to the stacktrace observed on
the L3 agent side.

Closes-bug: 1369012

Change-Id: I23cd9813fb9b67e9029d222d5f72733ecec3febb

commit_message:
Make HTTP client aware of no_proxy variable

Fix the problem of ceilometer client ignoring the host list in
no_proxy environment variable. Now proxy url is only used when
the Host of target URL is not in the no_proxy host list.

Closes-Bug: #1310805
Change-Id: I0b841291f1e8b9d9c7f431efd7d8f95d37df72b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-13 02:59:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/174_add_instance_type_access_uc.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Make sure instance_type_id index exist when db sync

When upgrade database from folsom to grizzly, then to havana. 184 -> 185 will
raise a exception. The reason is table 'instance_type_projects' lost a index
'instance_type_id' after running 174_add_instance_type_access_uc.

The patch make sure the index 'instance_type_id' is existed after adding UC.

commit_message:
Make sure instance_type_id index exist when db sync

When upgrade database from folsom to grizzly, then to havana. 184 -> 185 will
raise a exception. The reason is table 'instance_type_projects' lost a index
'instance_type_id' after running 174_add_instance_type_access_uc.

The patch make sure the index 'instance_type_id' is existed after adding UC.

Change-Id: Ib15dc87aa8af3f0f8070693283da77ee66fd42c8
Closes-Bug: #1239484

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V boot from volume live migration

Live migration fails on Hyper-V when boot from volume is used with
CoW, as the target host tries to cache the root disk image in
pre_live_migration, but in this case the image_ref is empty.

This patch adds a check to handle the empty image_ref case.

Change-Id: I60cb60ccaeb0cb8c536906d897249e31ae396923
Closes-Bug: #1362075

commit_message:
Uniquify horizon messages returned in a single response

A network operation can fail because of different
reasons - yet in many places just one error message
is provided. Combined with too broad exception clause,
and incorrect assumptions on the reasons of failure
(e.g. Neutron service being unavailable causes all
other sorts of errors like inability to Allocate IP
or Associate it) this leads to multiple errors when just one
would suffice. The fix aims to provide sensible error
messages in case the network service is down. This includes
returning only unique messages in a single response.

Partial-Bug: #1301374
Change-Id: Id6c620ca51f7703f35c0c172e39fdf237fa42278
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>

subject: CLI image-update gives a wrong help on '--tags' param
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 8759, 'name': 'Arnaud Legendre', 'email': 'arnaudleg@gmail.com', 'username': 'arnaud'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-10 05:56:08.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "CLI image-update gives a wrong help on '--tags' param

The help message tells end user image-update interface accepts 'tags'
param and could be used to update tag of image [0], but actually it
could trigger an 400 exception [1] due to wrong PATCH calls, and the
correct way is to use image-tag-update interface [2] as designed.

[0] glance image-update <IMG_ID> --tags <TAG_VALUE>

[1] 400 Bad Request
    Invalid JSON pointer for this resource: '/tags/0'
        (HTTP 400)

[2] glance image-tag-update <IMG_ID> <TAG_VALUE>

Change-Id: Iaa8041779510192dc08f7b898b8a1beda29a6398
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
CLI image-update gives a wrong help on '--tags' param

The help message tells end user image-update interface accepts 'tags'
param and could be used to update tag of image [0], but actually it
could trigger an 400 exception [1] due to wrong PATCH calls, and the
correct way is to use image-tag-update interface [2] as designed.

[0] glance image-update <IMG_ID> --tags <TAG_VALUE>

[1] 400 Bad Request
    Invalid JSON pointer for this resource: '/tags/0'
        (HTTP 400)

[2] glance image-tag-update <IMG_ID> <TAG_VALUE>

Change-Id: Iaa8041779510192dc08f7b898b8a1beda29a6398
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Remove kvm as a hypervisor_type argument

QEMU is used whether specifying either qemu or kvm as an argument to
hypervisor_type. Therefore, remove kvm as a supported argument.

Change-Id: I89f2b907fa868e50c2b65c2bf4a8e414242dd9fc
Closes-bug: #1195361

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-13 07:30:07.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

subject: Standardize the async result subclasses
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-18 21:35:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Standarize the async result subclasses

Move away from these subclasses exposing there properties
as publicly viewable and have them only expose the base
class functions as things that are publicly useable.

This also adjusts how the zookeeper async result had a usage
of camel casing that didn't seem to fit in the other naming
conventions that tooz uses.

Change-Id: Iaa1dd3bb7b359b2dab14a8aeeab9f2e3e9cd8d29
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-18 21:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py'], 'message': "Standardize the async result subclasses

Move away from these subclasses exposing there properties
as publicly viewable and have them only expose the base
class functions as things that are publicly useable.

This also adjusts how the zookeeper async result had a usage
of camelcasing that didn't seem to fit in the other naming
conventions that tooz uses.

Change-Id: Iaa1dd3bb7b359b2dab14a8aeeab9f2e3e9cd8d29
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Standardize the async result subclasses

Move away from these subclasses exposing there properties
as publicly viewable and have them only expose the base
class functions as things that are publicly useable.

This also adjusts how the zookeeper async result had a usage
of camelcasing that didn't seem to fit in the other naming
conventions that tooz uses.

Change-Id: Iaa1dd3bb7b359b2dab14a8aeeab9f2e3e9cd8d29

commit_message:
Add oslo_release.sh script

Add an oslo_release.sh script to help with alpha and final releases of
Oslo libraries. It makes use of an utility to rename Launchpad
milestones.

Change-Id: Ib87a22834eb79a12b46023b030cfef495d14540f

commit_message:
Retitle list of libraries

The PyCADF library is no part of the Oslo "Common Libraries" program.
Rather than reogranizing the documentation set around our governance,
retitle the libraries list more generically.

Change-Id: I07eb43a773256557e26b3478b411605c36f567c3

commit_message:
[DOC] Removed note about SAHARA_USE_NEUTRON in sahara-dashboard

Sahara-dashboard was merged to horizon. Horizon detects neutron by
itself and no additional settings are needed. Deleted the whole
section.

Change-Id: Id6bca92f924d271eed5a78b912b4014e25bb1ea8

subject: update incorrect keystone.conf file path and missing space.
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 09:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['doc/security-guide/ch024_authentication.xml'], 'message': 'update incorrect keystone.conf file path and missing space.

the file path Keystone conf file is located under /etc/keystone/keystone.conf instead of /etc/keystone.conf

Under Section Invalid login attempts, the sentence has a missing space before Detection:

If prevention is not an option, detection can be used to mitigate damage.Detection involves frequent

It is changed to:

If prevention is not an option, detection can be used to mitigate damage. Detection involves frequent

Change-Id: I82bc0144f9a9047f74dbbabf6dc12242f255a35c
Closes-Bug: #1368422
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
update incorrect keystone.conf file path and missing space.

the file path Keystone conf file is located under /etc/keystone/keystone.conf instead of /etc/keystone.conf

Under Section Invalid login attempts, the sentence has a missing space before Detection:

If prevention is not an option, detection can be used to mitigate damage.Detection involves frequent

It is changed to:

If prevention is not an option, detection can be used to mitigate damage. Detection involves frequent

Change-Id: I82bc0144f9a9047f74dbbabf6dc12242f255a35c
Closes-Bug: #1368422

commit_message:
Adm policy can't use other tenants unshared rules

If the firewall rules are not shared and if they belong to different
tenants, then admin should not be able to create a policy using
these rules and he should not be able to insert such rules into
policies. An exception should be raised in such case. Added new
‚ÄúFirewallRuleConflict‚Äù exception to handle such conditions.

Change-Id: Iac54ac8dfd96cce93ce938a23c9c976d09ab57d3
Closes-bug: 1327057

commit_message:
Update doc for qos_policy_group NetApp extra spec

Bug 1288283 updated the function behind the qos_policy_group extra spec,
but the docs were never updated to reflect the change in behavior from
being a capability advertised to the scheduler to being a directive that
needed to be executed post provisioning.

Cherry-picked from master:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122302/

In the above commit (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122302/), I
didn't follow the doc guidelines and used the term Cinder. This fixes
this snafoo.

Cherry-picked from master:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122487/

Change-Id: I226c58c112e8485951834978b4fb971edaad5d81
(cherry picked from commit f6357f2fca0a1bcb526af80a3e52e6adf336b1d7)

commit_message:
Remove #noqa from two common imports and add them to import_exceptions

We have two imports with #noqa: django.conf.urls.patterns and
django.conf.urls.url however using them is a standard way of creating
any urls.py module. So there are over 150 imports in Horizon code
where #noqa could be replaced with two lines in list of import_exceptions.

Change-Id: I81c3290e0dc958b5037dd6a87e44df18adfbe751

commit_message:
Corrects typos "coearse," "proejct," and "unecrypts"

Misspelling of "coerce" found in the docstring body
of method _boot from class ServerManager. Misspellings
of "project" and "unencrypts" found in docstrings
of client.py and crypto.py.

Change-Id: I052c321f3ad5e13aa57a559e2f28ec5eec32a9b4

commit_message:
tests: kill worker pids as well on timeouts

Workers that don't exit can also trigger a timeout, and we want our
test environment to be super robust - kill them aggressively too.

Also raise the timeout error so that we don't mask this when it
happens.

Change-Id: Iee606720f98e9a5e8a11f162eb885c0a00a2345e
Partial-Bug: #1357578

commit_message:
Set the default number of workers when running under eventlet

Keystone now defaults to n-cpu as the number of workers under eventlet with
a minimum number of workers when auto-calculating the number of 2.

This behavior can be overridded by changing the `admin_workers` and
`public_workers` configuration values in the Keystone config file.

Change-Id: I482cfef7ee14e995c6fb206bcef412957c54f491
Closes-Bug: #1371154

commit_message:
Add UTF-8 multibyte input validation to createImage server action

Adds extra input validation to the createImage server action
to ensure that invalid multibyte UTF-8 characters are not
in the image name.

Change-Id: I1bbfcfa8e3d379596a9dc4b415322099d4d6819d
Closes-Bug: 1006725

commit_message:
add '--insecure' to keystone command in register

When keystone service need cafile verification, can not
do registration work, we can use insecure mode to do all
registration work only in OpenStack installation process.

Change-Id: I246700aace69b192716982f2985856381cfee029
Closes-Bug: #1369241

commit_message:
Remove PYTHONHASHSEED=0 from tox.ini

We've ironed out remaining issues that crop up when running
with a random seed. This updates tox.ini to revert to the default
behavior of running with PYTHONHASHSEED=random.  The pep8 check
continues to run with PYTHONHASHSEED=0 to workaround oslo issues
around config value ordering in the check_uptodate.sh test.

Change-Id: Ifa0dba8c3970fc676d374f33c129ef0f9d526c94

commit_message:
Ensure 'address' in add_interface

The function _add_interface doesn't check whether the param "address" is
in request body. We should check it and catch KeyError.

Change-Id: Ia15b905e93033b8f5eee03fc2bffdd79dbd31045
Closes-Bug: #1254999

commit_message:
Setup subunit-trace as an entry point

This commit moves subunit-trace into the newly created cmd dir and
adds a pbr entry point to run it as a binary. This will enable using
subunit-trace just by installing tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I3ae379edca3e776e90a18d53393c4c1424d291f7

commit_message:
Safer check for enabled in trusts

For some LDAP backends, the enable attribute is not
directly set.  Since we have a wrapper function in identity/core,
we can use that instead.

Adds tests that disabling trustor or trustee prevents
trust execution.

Closes-Bug: 1367952

Change-Id: I6d3c26e0e6e6c0d27ea7b910340fae5792eaceda

subject: container.merge_items bug
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-18 19:27:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'container.merge_items bug

When replicated container entries get round-tripped through json, they wind up
with unicode objects for names.  This causes equality checks to fail against
container entries, and you can wind up with duplicate records.  My bad.

Change-Id: I3aee2ad8dbd3a617efe37e887cfb902a3e4a1646
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-18 19:38:03.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'container.merge_items bug

When replicated container entries get round-tripped through json, they wind up
with unicode objects for names.  This causes equality checks to fail against
container entries, and you can wind up with duplicate records.  My bad.

Change-Id: I3aee2ad8dbd3a617efe37e887cfb902a3e4a1646
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
container.merge_items bug

When replicated container entries get round-tripped through json, they wind up
with unicode objects for names.  This causes equality checks to fail against
container entries, and you can wind up with duplicate records.  My bad.

Change-Id: I3aee2ad8dbd3a617efe37e887cfb902a3e4a1646

commit_message:
Add the processutils from oslo-incubator.

This is a module specific add rather than a full sync. The processutils
module will be used to determine the default number of workers for keystone
running under eventlet.

Processutils sync'd from oslo commit hash 6a60f84258

Change-Id: I6cbca7d54ca97cce962d3cc1131388840ddf9a7c
Related-Bug: #1371154

To avoid other users to access scecret in keystone.conf, set the
file permission to 640 instead of 644

Fix bug 1369446

commit_message:
Add retry_after only to exceptions supporting it

Having retry_after in HTTP response header for 403 status code caused
client to fail with TypeError exception about unexpected keyword
argument. This is related to bug in nova-api. To prevent this kind of
client problems in the future patch adds check to from_response
function to pass retry-after header only to classes that inherit
from RetryAfterException and regression unit tests.

Change-Id: I6bfc8b33eb591d30b3c647397b11100094718e13
Closes-Bug: 1365251

commit_message:
Fix Django 1.7 compat

In Debian, we are going to release Jessie with Django 1.7,
which has just been released. Therefore, compatibility is
important for us.

This patch, which the Debian package already carries, fixes
2 small compatibility issues with Django 1.7. It is safe to
use openstack_auth with these patches and a lower version of
Django, which makes it safe to apply this patch.

Change-Id: I564cde889c56e12fc0fc1347537e66b576605a0d

commit_message:
Dismiss flavor detail pop-over on users next click

In the Instances table under Projects, when we click the flavor
link under Size column, a flavor details pop-over shows up.
Currently we cannot dismiss this pop-over unless user clicks the
flavor link again.

This patch is intended to fix this issue by dismissing the pop-over
on the user's next click.

Change-Id: I46e4d368ef174f04f245be8eef8b3b244c5d1201
Closes-Bug: #1370133

commit_message:
Style network address for subnet as required field

It does this by adding the required class to the network address field when the
checkbox is enabled.

I have also made the checkbox behave like a switchable select so when the create
subnet checkbox is checked all fields are visible. There are hidden when create
subnet is unselected.

Change-Id: Id45d5ce2a1bb55e4bcaa33df065ca2b1ccee3c7e
Closes-bug: 1367858

commit_message:
Update dib-run-parts

dib-run-parts in dib-utils had several fixes missing that had been
committed to diskimage-builder. When diskimage-builder switched to using
dib-run-parts from dib-utils, we lost these fixes. The switch over
happened in Ia0a0df7784a14c49b5c47ac0b03e6c2602c84b3b

These are the fixes from diskimage-builder that this commit adds back:
I44cf98dfc80cfcaec54b88cc83be80a3dbf2cec3
I24fd76c2b4f66b8036010b5079db39ead729abee
Iad2d490c86dceab148ea9ab08f457c49a5d5352e
Ieb48faacb4c96b7b358771d70c17f2f22d0354f4
Ia68853505485fefbf0890313456e7edb6097666b
Ibfb562c5970b40598fc95da1e8d4beb9d51d7612

Change-Id: Ice4b6a4b3d36a02099a682ae8cda4721211d51d9

commit_message:
Fix test failure in an lxc under osx

Adding a mock to prevent /proc/mounts lookup does
the trick of fixing the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1368942

commit_message:
Fail on None before iteration attempt

Check for a 'None' value before trying to iterate over it
in the bulk code. Also eliminates an unneccessary anonymous
recursive function in the same bulk handling code.

Closes-Bug: #1368055
Change-Id: Id4aca81e4882a3cdf9c790bdea0b0b515abc9a8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-01 09:10:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes HyperV VM Console Log

This patch intends to fix some small nits introduced along with
the Nova console log patch.

The size of the console log can get bigger than expected because
of a small nit when checking the existing log file size as well
as a wrong size constant.

The method which gets the serial port pipe at the moment returns
a list which contains at most one element being the actual pipe
path. In order to avoid confusion this should return the pipe path
or None instead of a list.

Change-Id: I5ce9d1bea572f9098971990d011fa97ebf09233e
Closes-Bug: #1363899

commit_message:
Fixes HyperV VM Console Log

This patch intends to fix some small nits introduced along with
the Nova console log patch.

The size of the console log can get bigger than expected because
of a small nit when checking the existing log file size as well
as a wrong size constant.

The method which gets the serial port pipe at the moment returns
a list which contains at most one element being the actual pipe
path. In order to avoid confusion this should return the pipe path
or None instead of a list.

Change-Id: I5ce9d1bea572f9098971990d011fa97ebf09233e
Closes-Bug: #1363899

commit_message:
Set API_WORKERS to 2 by default

Devstack is usually used in environments with large numbers of CPUs and
large numbers of OpenStack services that default the number of api
workers to the number of CPUS. This commonly results in hitting memory
limits. Drop the number of API workers down to 2 by default.

Change-Id: I1c610c372a2e14ae23af7417960743f471ba1cd0

commit_message:
always set --no-hosts for dnsmasq

Many network modes in nova-network disable reading host entries from
/etc/hosts. This includes running vish-ha (multihost), or if you ever
set a dns server. However if you don't do these things we continue to
use /etc/hosts.

It's not clear that this does anything other than create
inconsistency. There is a long standing bug that exists around this
because the impacts include exposing localhost as a dns entry on the
network.

Change-Id: Ibccf0999bfd4b37f2d948af34640260f95c54572
Closes-Bug: #1201873

subject: Make floatingip-ip-delete atomic with neutron
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-17 04:55:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/network/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py'], 'message': 'Make floatingip-ip-delete atomic with neutron

The infra guys were noticing an issue where they were leaking floating ip
addresses. One of the reasons this would occur for them is they called
nova floating-ip-delete which first disassocates the floating-ip in neutron
and then deletes it. Because nova-api makes two calls to neutron if the
first one succeeds and the second fails it results in the instance no longer
being associated with the floatingip. They have retry logic but they base it on
the instance and when they go to retry cleaning up the instance the floatingip
is no longer on the instance so they never delete it.

This patch fixes this issue by creating a new method
disassocate_and_delete_floating_ip which contains the different logic
needed to atomically do this for neutron rather than putting the logic
in the api layer to do something differently if one is using neutron.

This patch also adds additional code coverage for nova-network in the
delete floatingip case.

Closes-bug: 1356157

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py
	nova/network/base_api.py

Change-Id: I53b0c9d949404288e8687b304361a74b53d69ef3
(cherry picked from commit 5f391087d1d75dd4e7532252c312256e9c3ea2b9)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make floatingip-ip-delete atomic with neutron

The infra guys were noticing an issue where they were leaking floating ip
addresses. One of the reasons this would occur for them is they called
nova floating-ip-delete which first disassocates the floating-ip in neutron
and then deletes it. Because nova-api makes two calls to neutron if the
first one succeeds and the second fails it results in the instance no longer
being associated with the floatingip. They have retry logic but they base it on
the instance and when they go to retry cleaning up the instance the floatingip
is no longer on the instance so they never delete it.

This patch fixes this issue by creating a new method
disassocate_and_delete_floating_ip which contains the different logic
needed to atomically do this for neutron rather than putting the logic
in the api layer to do something differently if one is using neutron.

This patch also adds additional code coverage for nova-network in the
delete floatingip case.

Closes-bug: 1356157

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py
	nova/network/base_api.py

Change-Id: I53b0c9d949404288e8687b304361a74b53d69ef3
(cherry picked from commit 5f391087d1d75dd4e7532252c312256e9c3ea2b9)
